p: T. procumbens essential oils showed antioxidant activity, reducing levels of oxidative stress when using the DPPH assay. These essential oils appear to have higher antioxidant activity than ascorbic acid and in the study, it is pointed out that increasing the concentration of the essential oil consequently increases the antioxidant power. In the literature, T. procumbens is identified as a good candidate for the treatment of inflammation and cancer with fewer toxic effects [ 24], but these claims are not adequately researched and documented.
